questions.question: Which of the following best describes Data Science?

options.A: The process of designing and building efficient software applications.
options.B: The study of algorithms and data structures.
options.C: An interdisciplinary field that uses scientific methods, processes, algorithms, and systems to extract knowledge and insights from noisy, structured, and unstructured data.
options.D: The management and organization of large databases.

questions.question: What is the primary goal of data science?

options.A: To create visually appealing charts and graphs.
options.B: To develop new programming languages.
options.C: To discover patterns, insights, and knowledge from data.
options.D: To automate repetitive tasks.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically considered a core component of data science?

options.A: Statistics and Probability
options.B: Machine Learning
options.C: Web Development
options.D: Domain Expertise

questions.question: What role does domain expertise play in data science?

options.A: It is not important as data can speak for itself.
options.B: It helps in understanding the context of the data and formulating relevant questions.
options.C: It is only necessary for presenting the findings.
options.D: It is primarily used for data cleaning.

questions.question: Which stage of the data science lifecycle involves understanding the business problem and defining objectives?

options.A: Data Exploration
options.B: Data Modeling
options.C: Business Understanding
options.D: Deployment

questions.question: What is the purpose of Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)?

options.A: To build predictive models.
options.B: To clean and preprocess the data.
options.C: To summarize the main characteristics of a dataset, often using visual methods.
options.D: To deploy the machine learning model.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common programming language used in data science?

options.A: HTML
options.B: CSS
options.C: Python
options.D: Java

questions.question: What is the difference between structured and unstructured data?

options.A: Structured data is numerical, while unstructured data is textual.
options.B: Structured data has a predefined format (e.g., tables), while unstructured data does not (e.g., text, images).
options.C: Structured data is easier to analyze than unstructured data.
options.D: There is no significant difference between them.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of structured data?

options.A: A customer review.
options.B: A social media post.
options.C: A spreadsheet with customer information.
options.D: An image of a product.

questions.question: What is the role of algorithms in data science?

options.A: To store and manage large datasets.
options.B: To automate the process of data collection.
options.C: To provide a set of rules or steps to solve a specific problem, such as pattern recognition or prediction.
options.D: To visualize data effectively.

questions.question: What is the significance of 'big data' in the context of data science?

options.A: It refers to data that is too large to be processed by traditional methods, requiring specialized tools and techniques.
options.B: It is simply a large collection of any type of data.
options.C: It only includes unstructured data from the internet.
options.D: It is important for visualization purposes only.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key challenge associated with big data?

options.A: The small variety of data formats.
options.B: The ease of processing with traditional software.
options.C: The volume, velocity, variety, veracity, and value of the data.
options.D: The lack of need for specialized analytical techniques.

questions.question: What is the purpose of data preprocessing?

options.A: To build machine learning models.
options.B: To visualize the final results.
options.C: To clean, transform, and organize raw data into a suitable format for analysis.
options.D: To deploy the model into production.

questions.question: What is the difference between correlation and causation?

options.A: They are the same thing and can be used interchangeably.
options.B: Correlation implies that one variable causes another, while causation indicates a statistical relationship.
options.C: Correlation indicates a statistical relationship between two or more variables, while causation implies that one variable directly influences another.
options.D: Causation is easier to determine from observational data than correlation.

questions.question: What is the role of data visualization in data science?

options.A: To store large amounts of data efficiently.
options.B: To build complex machine learning models.
options.C: To communicate insights and patterns in data effectively to a wider audience.
options.D: To clean and preprocess the data.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a data science application in the healthcare industry?

options.A: Designing user interfaces for medical devices.
options.B: Developing algorithms for disease prediction and diagnosis.
options.C: Managing hospital finances.
options.D: Training medical staff.

questions.question: What are some ethical considerations in data science?

options.A: Data privacy and security.
options.B: Bias in algorithms.
options.C: Responsible use of AI.
options.D: All of the above.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a data science workflow or pipeline?

options.A: To confuse stakeholders with technical jargon.
options.B: To provide a structured and reproducible approach to solving data-driven problems.
options.C: To limit creativity in data analysis.
options.D: To make the process more complex.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common type of bias that can occur in data?

options.A: Random sampling bias.
options.B: Selection bias.
options.C: Computational bias.
options.D: Algorithmic efficiency bias.

questions.question: What is the importance of reproducibility in data science research?

options.A: It makes the research faster to conduct.
options.B: It allows others to verify the findings and build upon the work.
options.C: It ensures that the data is always perfectly clean.
options.D: It simplifies the deployment of machine learning models.
